fields.description:
Currently Agile charts such as the Burn-down Chart can not be configured to exclude non-working *hours*. 
I would like to have a configurable work hour setting similar to the Working Days setting.
fields.summary: Ability to configurable non-working hours for Agile charts

fields.description:
h5. Summary 
We have a team interested to do parallel sprints in JIRA Agile. Currently it seems like a global setting for the entire instance. 

h5. Suggestion
It would be great to be able to enable these on a per board, per project or few project basis.
fields.summary: Parallel sprints should be configurable on a per board or per project basis, not just a global setting

fields.description: Please see the attached screenshots for more information.
fields.summary: Plugin icon is not visible in agile issue details tab when using IE11

fields.description:
h5. Summary
Currently, I need to click SO MANY TIMES to just edit basic fields in Jira agile.  Modern tools do not require so many clicks for 80% common actions (and the old greenhopper product had this implemented).  I am having trouble convincing folks we should use Jira when editing issues is so hard.

h5. Suggestion
I should be able to click any field on a CARD or on the Agile sidebar and edit it.  I should not have to click ... and then edit issue and then save.

Screenshot for reference: https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/1p391L3C0V2a2E3j012O/Image%202015-09-20%20at%2010.46.34%20PM.png
fields.summary: Be able to edit all fields inline

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you try to log work on an unestimated issue, it is not reflected in the burndown chart.
(!) Note that logging work on an unestimated issue also automatically sets its Remaining Estimate to *0m*. 
After the first work log, the remaining estimate is now set to 0m by JIRA. Now, if we try to log work again on this issue, it gets reflected in the burndown chart even though its Remaining Estimate is already 0m. 
Entry Screenshot: [^ZeroRemainingEstimate.png]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board and sprint. Set board to use Original Time Estimate and use Time Tracking.
# Create an issue with no original or remaining estimates. (leave it unestimated)
# Start sprint.
# Log work on that issue. Notice the remaining estimate is change from Unestimated to 0m. Check Burndown chart to confirm no work log is shown here.
# Log work again. Notice remaining is still 0m, but the Burndown chart is showing the work you just logged. (it still doesn't show the work you logged when the issue was still unestimated)

h3. Suggested Solution
Its weird that we still record work logs for 0m remaining estimates, but we don't record it for Unestimated issues. Suggestion is to include the work log for unestimated issues as well.
fields.summary: Work logged on unestimated issues should be reflected in Burndown Chart

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A new feature in Agile is that when an issue is a subtask, the name of the parent task will be listed above the subtask in grey.

The issue with this is that issues listed in grey usually lead users to believe that there is something wrong with that issue specifically. 

Additionally, it's not possible to click this.

I can understand how useful it is, if you want to have a subtask in one column and a parent in another, but we may want to adjust how it appears to reduce confusion.

See attachment for how it appears currently.

h3. Suggested Solution
For example, maybe write in bold or another color "subtask of : ABC-123", or say parent task: ABC-123
fields.summary: Greyed parent task above sub-task is misleading

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce using Jira OnDemand:
* Create new status ‘Deployed’ and map to category Done
* Add to workflow and allow transition from all statuses 
* Configure Agile board for project and add Deployed status to the Done column
Note:  we also used Original Estimate for Statistic and Remaining Estimate/Time Spent for Time Tracking
* Start new sprint with two issues each with an Original Estimate of 2 days
* Complete issue 1 and set status to Done
* Complete issue 2 and set status to Deployed
* Complete the Sprint
{color:#14892c}* See Velocity and Sprint Report show 4 days complete at both Project and Component Level{color}
* Update the status on issue 2 from Deployed to Done
* Remove Deployed status from workflow
* Delete Deployed status
{color:#d04437}* Receive internal server error when trying to view Reports at Project Level
* At Component Level, the velocity chart now shows 2 days complete
* At Component Level, the Sprint Report shows Issue 1 as Complete still, but now Issue 2 shows as being removed from sprint{color}
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when viewing reports at Project Level after Removing Custom Status mapped to Done category

fields.description:
In the Create Issue and Edit Issue screens, the "Sprint" menu should list sprint names in the "Suggestions" that are disambiguated by board. 
This already happens in the lower "All sprints" section of the menu, but not in the upper "Suggestions" section.

Without this disambiguation it is easy for users to select an identically-named sprint (e.g. "Sprint 3") from the wrong board.

This would be nice because "Sprint 1", "Sprint 2", etc, are the JIRA default names for sprints, so it is common for the boards of multiple projects to have identically named sprints and thus be completely ambiguous in the Sprint menu.
fields.summary: Sprint name should be disambiguous when creating or editing issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently you are only able to see the Epic's *Issue ID* and *Summary* but you are not able to see the Epic's Name on the Kanban Board. To elaborate and clarify further:
!epic_full.png|thumbnail!
Notice the epic's Summary and Name and the issues linked to the epic.
However, look at the board below:
!kanban.png|thumbnail!
Where the linked issues *SKP-2* and *SKP-10* have the epic ithey where linked to displayed. However, the Epic *SKP-17* doesn't have its name displayed. Having the Name displayed on the Epic on the Board will help in better and easier identification of the Epic.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add *Epic Name* to the cards that are Epic on the Kanban Board.

Note:
Ignore other screenshots attached to this ticket. They are irrelevant as the suggestion request has been changes from its initial state.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to see the Epic Name Field displayed on the Kanban Board

fields.description:
We use one program and one project and one structure.
Within the project we have multiple teams and thus boards.

Now I ran into contraints that really surporised me so here goes:

1.
Why only admins can start and create sprints as this is typically the role of a scrum master.
Now I have to make all scrum masters admin, meaning they have full control over project and program.In the current setup within Jira the role scrum master is useless.

2.
We use the hiearchy where epics are the toplevel. so epics are realized by features and features are relealized by stories and tasks.
Now the epic is program wide and the featiures are team specific. In other words which teams are needed to realize an epic en which features do they have to complete in order to do so.
The teams would like to see the features in the backlog under the epic link as the features are the big items they need to work on as a team. however Jira can only show EPICs, which basically means that all EPICS will be shown on every team backlog even if epics do not require effort from your team. Due to this limitation we now have changes all Epics to Features and all Features to Epics.
Now the Epic list on the backlog of the teams only shows which the epics that are assigned to that specific team.

3.
Epic link: Why is the epic link nothing more then a label?
If I drag items from the backlog to the epic link the field epic link is filled with the epic however it is not a real link. as when I really want to link stories to epics I have to go the link option and choose realizes and search for the Epic I want to link the story to. Only this way it appears as an child of the EPIC on the structure board.
Why can it not directly make a real link.

4.
Unable to link items on creation.
I now first need to create the issue and then edit the issue again and choose for link in the menu.
Why can I not link it directly without having to reopen the item again.


Kind regards,

Maarten Uppelschoten
fields.summary: Big improvements possible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the administrator in a board in the view with 'groups' and 'users', the only username recognized is the user's first username, in case it has been changed.

This is reproducible in JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a new instance with default permissions, login with a user belonging to these groups only: administators, site-admins (and if it is sysadmin, you can also belong to system-administrators)
#* This is because the fields for configuring of administrators change depending on permissions
# Create a Scrum board
# Create another user with username 'user1'
# Change the user's username to 'user2'
# Go to the board's 'General Configuration' page
# Click 'Administrators' to change the administrators
#* Two fields must appear: 'Groups' and 'Users'. Otherwise, this bug won't happen
# Add 'user2'

h3. Expected Results
The user2 (previous username user1) is added as administrator.

h3. Actual Results
The user is not added. This error appears:
!error_user.png|thumbnail!
It reads:
{panel}
Error
"user2" is not a valid user.
{panel}
 
h3. Notes
The field expected 'user1', though it's actually 'user2' its current username. This is actually stored and kept by JIRA.

Depending on the configuration, when editing this field, this will be visible:
!page.png|thumbnail!

Instead of 'Groups' and 'Users', only one field is visible (that’s why the groups were limited to reproduce the problem). In this case, JIRA will accept the correct usernames.
fields.summary: Changing administrator in board only recognizes old username

fields.description: Like gmail with unread mails show in the kanban board page title the number of items in state "waiting for support". This way It would be easy to now If a new request support has arribed, without having the kanban board page in focus.
fields.summary: In kanban board title page show number of items in "waiting for support"

fields.description:
The agile drop down often takes ~5 seconds to open on JAC.

I've attached a video of my pain.
fields.summary: Make Agile drop down less slow

fields.description:
When a Sprint is created and the start / end date are estimated, the diagram line values from Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget and Burndown Chart Report are not the same. 
For example:
By creating a 3 days Sprint duration I'll have a Burndown Chart with STORY POINTS X TIME lines. The Time line would have labels like: {{12:00, 16:00, 20:00, 0:00, 4:00, 8:00, 12:00, 16:00, 20:00, 0:00, 4:00, 8:00}}. 
But if you add the burndown Gadget to your dashboard it will display these few different labels:
{{16:00, 0:00, 8:00, 16:00, 0:00, 8:00}}

As an admin I'd like to see the same start and end labels through the gadget and the chart report.
fields.summary: Time labels for Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget and Burndown Chart Report are not the same

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you uninstall JIRA Agile, we are unable to safely remove all data from the database. This is especially problematic in cases where JIRA Agile was test out with random data and then once the admin wants to reset the test data and use JIRA Agile, then we has no way to do this as during uninstall the JIRA Agile Plugin data is maintained and will reappear once the plugin is re-installed. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a button, which only the admin can access, where they can reset all data from the JIRA Agile. This will have confirmation message to make sure that the admin doesn't mistakenly delete all data.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to be able to clear (reset) all JIRA Agile data from the database

fields.description: daniel@dataknowhow.dk
fields.summary: Udvidelse af skærm til 4K

fields.description: Deleting the filter will cause the agile board (associated with the deleted filter) to disappear. JIRA should have the functionality to prompt warning message if the filter is being associated with any Agile boards.
fields.summary: Deleting filter should prompt a warning message if filter is associated with any board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing the Active Sprint for a project, the start and end dates for the sprint are not displayed. You must hover over the 'Remaining Time' in the upper right in order to see the tooltip that contains the start and end dates.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the start and end dates for the sprint without the need to hover over the remaining time. Display the dates statically as they are in the Backlog view.
 
h3. Workaround 
Hover over the 'Remaining Time' text in the upper right.
fields.summary: Display Sprint Start and End Date in Active Sprints View

fields.description:
At the moment, the parallel sprint features is available in JIRA Agile lab. However, this is not supported by Atlassian. 

It would be great to have this feature available in JIRA Agile by default and to be officially supported.
fields.summary: Having parallel sprint feature in JIRA by default and to be officially supported

fields.description:
Create issue and subtask.
In classic issue view, header shows Project Name / Issue Name and Link / Sub-Task Name and Link, which makes navigation to issue from a sub-task easy.
On the Agile Board, 
a) relation of issue and sub-task is indicated in the board (but cannot be clicked)
b) issue is not shown as a back-reference in the detail view of the sub-task
-> no easy way of navigating to the main issue
fields.summary: Link to parent issue not shown in board issue detail view

fields.description:
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getSelectedNavigationItem' of undefined

See attached screen grab.

This happens on some of our agile board but not others.
fields.summary: Agile boards fail to load with Javascript error
TL for 3 years

fields.description:
If the parallel sprint feature in JIRA Agile labs is enabled and in future if this feature is discontinued what would be the impact/effects on the projects that use parallel sprints.
can the data be restored.
fields.summary: Regarding JIRA Agile labs.

fields.description: As an admin, I would like the ability to configure the layout of Agile Cards, specifically field placement. While you can add fields to each card, you cannot choose where the fields are on the card. The biggest issue this causes is when a field is added, it cannot be moved to be on the first line in the card and creates a new line. This can be viewed by some users to be a waste of space, and it will cause a lot less issues to be viewed in a browser. To better explain this, I have attached a user's screenshot showing what he wishes he could do.
fields.summary: Control of Agile Card Layout

fields.description:
h5. Summary
While using swim lanes, once a story has sub-tasks, the Active Sprint screen in JIRA no longer displays the EPIC associated with the story.

h5. Suggestion
It would be nice to be able to customize the Active Sprint, for example, to display the Epic name for stories with sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Allow Active Sprint Customization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way of sorting the Epics in Backlog screen. The only option is to physically drag and drop to arrange the order of the epics.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an automatic alphabetically ascending/descending order option.
fields.summary: As a User, I want to be able to alphabetically sort the Epics in Backlog screen
Incorrect drop down menu

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There exists no current functionality to allow for renaming statuses through the JIRA Agile simplified workflow. If any edits or changes are made to the underlying workflow through JIRA (rather than JIRA Agile) it breaks the simplification functionality that Agile provides. There is a bug raised for this under GHS-8740.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide functionality within Agile to allow for changing status names in the Configure Columns section (where the add status functionality current lives).
 
h3. Workaround 

There is no current known workaround that will enable Agile to continue the simplified workflow after it has been modified.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to rename JIRA Agile Simplified workflow status names

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Earlier in September 2021 we released an implementation of this Suggestion to a cohort of users as an experiment. After overwhelming feedback on this ticket and through other channels we decided to roll back this implementation. While the feature alleviated pain for some customers, it unfortunately did not meet customer expectations.

We will be exploring different solutions and will keep you updated. Thank you everyone for your ongoing feedback and patience.

We understand that some of you may still be interested in using the earlier implementation. As a result, for a limited time, we will be offering customers the ability to opt in and trial the initial implementation.

Before opting in please consider how this will impact you:
 * The experience will mirror that of Classic Projects in Jira Software Server - there is no configurability / toggle

 * Once active this will be enabled across your entire Jira Software site and will impact all users

 * Eventually this implementation will be replaced with an updated experience, so this opt-in will only be temporary, and the change of experience may occur without advanced notice

If you are a site admin and want to opt in, please submit your details on this [form|https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfHABAGahDbmEkmSclcscQHTp9Dawpxxz4AfOE964CCwvUQ1A/viewform]

We will only consider requests made by a site admin due to the impact it will have on all users.

Kind regards,

Andrew

Jira Software
{panel}
h4. Summary

Currently kanban columns are auto-sized to fit to screen and when using a small screen, the size of the columns makes them completely unusable.
h4. Suggestion

As an agile project manager, it is desirable to have horizontal scrolling available on kanban boards. 
 It would also be desirable to have some minimum width after which a scroll bar will appears to allow side scrolling.

Create a configuration to toggle this feature ON and OFF.
fields.summary: Jira Company-managed Board Horizontal Scrolling

fields.description:
The unestimated line on the version report is incorrect.

*STEPS TO REPRODUCE*
# Setup a scrum board for a project
# Add some user stories and fill in the story points field
# Add some user stories with empty story points field
# Create a version
# Add all user stories to the version
# Bring up the version report
# Switch the version report to show the version you created that has both estimated and unestimated stories

_EXPECTED_
There should be a red line that shows the # of unestimated tickets

_ACTUAL_
The red line that indicates the number of unestimated tickets is at the bottom of the graph indicating incorrectly that there are no unestimated tickets
fields.summary: Version Report is Incorrect

fields.description:
Our Product Owner at Widespace usually looks at the Burndown Chart to keep track of the progress of the sprint. When we have few but large Stories or Issues, it becomes hard to see the progress being made, since the values are only decremented when the whole task is completed.

We try to split the tasks up with several sub-tasks, and complete those as we make progress. However, these sub-tasks don't contribute to the red line on the Burndown Chart. Shouldn't they? If not, how do you recommend we structure our issues to better keep track of their progress through the Burndown Chart? 

(As an aside, it was really hard to report this issue. I have an account through the company, but I couldn't seem to report an issue from there. I had to create a new account, just to do that.)
fields.summary: Burndown chart doesn't include subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12535].
  {panel}

Description:
If you create a screen for an Epic and you set it up so that it uses tabs, if you do not put the Epic Name field on the first tab, on reboot, the system automatically places a second Epic Name field on the first tab. Both fields can be given different epic names.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new custom built screen that contains at least 2 tabs
2. Place the "Epic Name" field on some other tab than the first tab
3. Attach the screen to an epic as usual
4. Reboot the system
5. Check the screen

Results:
A second Epic Name field was automatically added to the first screen
fields.summary: When creating Epic screens with tabs, if Epic Name is not on first tab, then a second Epic Name field gets added automatically

fields.description:
I would like to be able to have an issue auto-flagged (in the scrum / kanban board) if it is linked as a blocking issue! I shouldn't have to link something as a blocking issue and then because I can't query in JQL for blocking / linked issues (and thus change the card colour or something) the only way I can visually represent a blocking / blocked issue is to then go in and flag it in addition to having  added a link.


Kind of related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4651
fields.summary: Be able to automatically flag issues if they are linked as blockers
When in Backlog view and there are no items in current Sprint, we are unable to drag items from the backlog in to the Sprint.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
Version report can get confusing for versions with multiple stories.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a board
* Set up a version to that board and add stories to it
* Open the version report

*Expected Result*
* Report is displayed with clear and easy to see indication of the stories

*Actual Result*
* Multiple stories overlap each other and make it harder to identify which's which. Attached screen shot of an example.

*Suggested solution*
* This report could be a bit wider to make the visibility of the whole version better. Also, clicking on the story "ball" should provide a link to the story directly to improve mobility.
fields.summary: Version Report can get overwhelming with a large Version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an Admin, I want to add a new panel on an Agile Board like product (which is a custom field). Currently we have only *Epics* and *Versions* on the panel.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to add custom fields to the Agile Board panel.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to add a new panel on an Agile Board

fields.description:
We use JIRA onDemand and have purchased the JIRA Agile add on - we love it but we do have one small niggle.

We understand that Scrum performs best when you have physical boards and co-located teams, we aren't in that position. We are globally distributed over multiple timezones and our team members perform their Daily Scrum via Skype or Google Hangouts etc and from experience it seems that many companies are doing the same thing - Scrum is going distributed.

One thing we  have realised is the importance of the team being able at a glance see how their Sprint is going - and if we had a physical board we would be able to easily tell how many "stickies" were either in progress, or to - do. 

Now with the Active Sprint view - it does give that information - but you have to scroll up and down for it, and it's hard to get that "big but quick glance picture".

We have experimented with other tools such as RealTimeBoard - that has a great zoom and  the teams felt that using that tool it bridged the gap between the virtual board and a physical board. However JIRA is better at managing a backlog than RealTimeBoard with all it's filters, searching, tagging, bug raising etc so we have stuck with it.

I would love it if the Active Sprint view was effectively a canvas that you could scroll, pan, and zoom in/out on (though I appreciate that it's a biggy...:) .

Keep it up.

Thanks

Damien
fields.summary: Zoom out function for Active Sprint View.

fields.description:
As a JIRA admin, I would like to grant other users permissions to change the configuration of an existing board.

Currently, I have to add the JIRA Administrator Global permission, so the users can configure the board.

It would be nice if I had a separate permission in the board, so other users can configure the board without being a JIRA Administrator.
fields.summary: Separate permission to configure board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when you edit a story to add an epic to it, then the epic link drop down menu list all the epics available, including Epics that are closed. This could especially be a problem when you have a large number of epics.

h3. Suggested Solution
The dropdown should not include epics that have been closed
fields.summary: As an Admin, I do not want to see closed Epics displayed in epic-link field dropdown list of a story

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12515].
  {panel}

In an effort to aggregate sprint data, teams are wishing to search and return issue related to all sprints with their standard name (i.e ScrumNinjas*). 

They'd like to be able to search as follows:
Sprint ~"ScrumNinjas"

And have it match all sprints with that as part of the name. Partial matching is currently unsupported for the Sprint field.
fields.summary: Allow Sprint field to accept partial match on sprint name

fields.description:
Hi,
I have observed a specific problem at several of my clients for which I think I have a functional solution and I would like to ask if it is possible that this feature would be implemented in a future version of JIRA Agile.

Next to (user) stories (describing e.g. new functionality) many of the teams of my clients also add Issue Types such as "Impediments" or "Improvements" to their sprints. If the swimming lane is set to 'Stories" these non-story type of Issues usually end up on the bottom of the board (as they have no subtasks). Quite often, I get the question of it is possible to make sure that certain issues types (for example the Impediments) are always on the top row.

Usually we try then to base the swimming lanes on a JQL query. This works in a sense that we can choose to put the Impediments on the top (for example). However, the user stories and their subtasks end then up in one swimming lane, which can be a bit messy (some teams have many subtasks).

So what I am looking for is being able to combine the best of both worlds: base the swimming lanes on JQL queries AND within those swimming lanes group the user stories with their subtasks (for example by having small swimming lanes withing the JQL-swimming lanes). I think that this would be a great addition for many teams.

Would you please consider this?

Thanks,
Jasper
fields.summary: Improvement on Swimming lane settings for Agile Board

fields.description:
We utilize the Atlassian-hosted instance of JIRA.

We use the Flagged field to indicated impediments to tickets.  Our projects have custom contexts for the Flagged field to select the reason for the flag such as: Waiting on customer, Defect rework, Dependent on another US, etc.)

Once the item is unblocked and the Flagged field is unchecked, there is no way for us to run historical reports of:
1. Total number of Flagged incidents
2. Type of Flagged incidents (based on the drop down option selected when flagged)
3. #days item was in Flagged state

Being able to report on these things for a given time period in history would be very valuable to our teams to identify and remediate the most frequent causes of blockage in our flow.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Allow reporting on Flagged field usage in history

fields.description:
h2. Affected Version
{{7.0.0-D20150819T011040}}

h2. Problem Description

Error {{jqlQuery should not be null}} returned when viewing the work board. 
Stack trace seen in the logs:
{noformat}
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574277500 2015-08-31 16:09:44,569 ajp-nio-127.0.0.104-8009-exec-131 WARN sysadmin 969x6261x1 1vrszv9 131.103.28.240,104.192.141.2 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel.json [c.a.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl] null key passed to i18n.getText
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574279500 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The key argument must not be null
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574280500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl$I18nHelperWrapper.nullCheck(I18nFactoryServiceImpl.java:205)
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574292500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl$I18nHelperWrapper.getText(I18nFactoryServiceImpl.java:121)
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574293500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.SwimlaneHelper.toEditModel(SwimlaneHelper.java:252)
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574293500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.SwimlaneHelper.buildSwimlaneEditModel(SwimlaneHelper.java:66)
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574295500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditHelper.getEditModel(RapidViewEditHelper.java:163)
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574295500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditResource$8.call(RapidViewEditResource.java:216)
2015-08-31 16:09:44.574296500 	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditResource$8.call(RapidViewEditResource.java:209)
{noformat}

h2. Diagnose

It *only* affects customers with Query defined for Swim lanes.
{noformat}
select * from "AO_60DB71_SWIMLANE" where "LONG_QUERY" is null;
{noformat}
(!) Please ensure to check this only when you are using the affected version stated above, it does not apply to the previous version

If the above return some roll, it is more likelihood to be affected by this issue.

h2. Environment

Currently this version only available for Cloud Customers, so please raise a support ticket referencing this ticket if you bump into this error, for the supporters to help fixing the instance.
fields.summary: Deprecated QUERY Column Causing Error jqlQuery should not be null when viewing the board

fields.description:
This has been reported by a Cloud customer and I can reproduce on the EAP driver (m01).

Trying to update an issue with the following results in a internal server error. The same json format for the Epic Link custom field works correctly on a create, just not the update. 
{noformat}
{"fields":{"customfield_11261":"ZAGILE-1"}}
{noformat}

{noformat}
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_45]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_45]

	... 64 filtered

The meta data is incorrect/ambiguous in this case. I reported the general problem of custom field metadata to Dave Meyer earlier.

Let me know if there is a different format required for the update of this field compared to the create case.

Here is the metadata:
{noformat}
Id  . . . . . . . . . . . . . : customfield_11261
Name  . . . . . . . . . . . . : Epic Link
Description . . . . . . . . . : 
Required  . . . . . . . . . . : false
Has default . . . . . . . . . : false
Has allowed values  . . . . . : false

Item type . . . . . . . . . . : string
Custom  . . . . . . . . . . . : true
Custom type . . . . . . . . . : com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link
Custom id . . . . . . . . . . : 11261
{noformat}
fields.summary: Internal server error updating Epic Link field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Day/Month/Year Format in Look and Feel is set to yy/MMM/dd, which works within Issues, but not for the Release Date field of the Versions column the Backlog page.


h3. Environment
Server and Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into JIRA
# Type GG
# Type Look and Feel
# Change Day/Month/Year format

h3. Expected Results

Day/Month/Year Format in Look and Feel is set to yy/MMM/dd, which works within Issues, as well as the Release Date field of the Versions column the Backlog page.


h3. Actual Results

Day/Month/Year Format in Look and Feel is set to yy/MMM/dd, which works within Issues, but not for the Release Date field of the Versions column the Backlog page.
fields.summary: Dates inconsistent across issues and release dates

fields.description:
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud
Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Bring up the issue detail view from within a JIRA Agile board.
# Select Attach Screenshot from the "..." menu at the top-right.

h3. Expected Results
The dialog loads fully and it's possible to paste and attach a screenshot to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The "Your image will be pasted here" pane doesn't load properly and you can't paste anything into it:

!screenshot-dialog.png!

h3.Workaround
Open the issue in JIRA itself, rather than Agile, and attach the screenshot from there.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot dialog doesn't load fully when used from within JIRA Agile, throws errors

fields.description:
This is very confusing... and annoying.

All workflows has:
- To Do
- In Progress
- Done

Sometimes instead of "To Do" is old Open and in place of Done is Closed...

So now you have a status categories so maybe it might be a good idea to choose a responding status from those lists.
Or maybe force projects which has Epics to have those statuses (To Do, In Progress, Done).

There is also {code}statusCategory{code} which migh be a good use here.
fields.summary: Use Jira built-in statuses instead of "Epic Status" custom field

fields.description:
I use Sprint Name as a indication for the date of the sprint and a sprint goal.

For example (we have 1 week iteration):
{code}
2015-09 week 1 - Admin Panel Overhaul
{code}
or 
{code}
2015-09 week 2 - General Acceptance Testing
{code}

The sprint goal is very important to keep focus of each team member on the most important outcome of the sprint. Thanks to this one we can focus on delivering the most business valuable stories in the first place. Moreover the Daily Scrum is driven with the information regarding sprint goal only.

Date if for the ordering purposes, and renders very nice descriptions in issue screen (available on board...) and very nice dropdown at charts screen.

Moreover we have developed a tool to build sprint reports in confluence with short summary of the sprint.

In my opinion this meaningful sprint naming convention has far more value than Sprint 1, Sprint 2 etc...

Hence the 30 character limit is... too short.
I have checked in the database and it shouldn't be a problem to extend this one.
fields.summary: Extend the Sprint Name input box maxlength
jira-greenhopper-api is not part of the source code distribution

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when loading agile board which contains large set of data, there is only a spinning icon when loading.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have a progress bar showing the percentage to completion as to let customer know how long more it will took to finish loading the agile board itself.
fields.summary: progress bar when loading agile board

fields.description:
At the moment, the feature to show *total number of story point* for each column is only available for Scrum board (Backlog mode). 

It would be great to have this feature to be implemented in *Work/Active Sprint* mode of *Kanban Board*. This will help the users to keep track of what's on their plate. The issue count is not enough, because each issues would have different story points.
fields.summary: Show the total of story point per column in Work/Active Sprint mode in Kanban Board

fields.description: The current implementation of Agile Charts does not take color blindness into consideration. We do not think that making the colors configurable would make things much better, but perhaps having one of the lines dotted and the other one being kept solid would be easy enough to implement and help a great deal.
fields.summary: Consider Colorblindness

fields.description:
When trying to load an issue detail (on the sidebar) on the "Backlog" or the "Active sprints" page, Firefox hangs for a minute, completely unresponsive (the whole browser, all tabs). Sometimes it just shows a red popup that says "Timeout error" and sometimes it loads and then sometimes I get:

{quote}An error occurred
Hide…

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details

        Exception: Script error.
        Resource: https://ace.atlassian.com/j/?zoneid=63&cb=585960564&charset=UTF-8&loc=https%3A//flashvote.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa%3FrapidView%3D1%26view%3Dplanning%26selectedIssue%3DMVP-715%26quickFilter%3D3&referer=https%3A//flashvote.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa%3FrapidView%3D1%26view%3Dplanning%26selectedIssue%3DMVP-715%26quickFilter%3D3&callback=jQuery172036130410245592026_1440798079979&_=1440798082180
        Line: 0
        Column: 0

Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:41.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/41.0{quote}

This happens the first time I try to open an issue. Subsequent issues open without a problem.
fields.summary: Firefox hangs when loading an issue detail in the Agile Boards

fields.description:
After the latest release of JIRA 7, if we drag a "To Do" status like _Open_ to "Done" Column, JIRA will ignore this association and will resolve recently opened issues. 
For example, after associating the _Open_ status to the "Done" column, users will create an issue  at the current sprint and this issue will disappear from backlog. It will also receive the "unresolved" resolution and the "Done" status.

Some steps to reproduce:
1- Create an agile board.
2 - Configure the board and map statuses to columns. Put an Open status into a Done column.
3 - Create a Sprint with some issues.
4 - Put some un-resolved issues into the column you configured with the open status.
6 - Close the sprint and note that issues will disappear from backlog and assume the status/resolution mentioned below.

JIRA Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040
fields.summary: Done Column ignores the Status associated

fields.description:
After creating a new workflow status and associating it to "Done" column of an Agile Board, JIRA will show its transition on the mentioned column.

Steps to reproduce:
1 - Select a workflow with 3 statuses: Open, In Progress and Resolved.
2 - Add a new status with "To Do" category.
3 - Create back and forth transitions (cardinality 1:1) between the new status and Open status.
4 - Create back and forth transitions (cardinality 1:1) between the new status and In progress status.
5 - Create a Project with any simple issue tracking and associate it with the workflow created before.
6 - Create a Scrum board from an existing project and associate it with the project recently created.
7 - On Board > Configure Board > Columns drag the Unmapped status (the one created previously on step 2) to the "Done" Column.
8 - Create some issues and Start a Sprint. Move the issues from "To Do" to "Done" column. You'll see the transition related to the status recently created on mentioned column.


JIRA Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040
fields.summary: Workflow transitions are shown in Agile Board columns

fields.description:
Opening https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=380&projectKey=SRCTREEWIN on Firefox (here it's version 40.0.2) ends up in a freeze.

Moments later Firefox pops up with "unresponsive script". Stop script is the only way to resurrect him again.

The Sourcetree Kanban board shows
1983 Unscheduled	2 In Progress	760 Done issues
fields.summary: Kanban board performance freezes Firefox

fields.description: When we select a quick filter (by a simple click) we would like that previously selected filters becomes unselected by default. The issue is that most of time we need to activate one filter at the same time, so we are forced to unselect manually previous filters one by one. We could enhance the selection functionality to combine several filters together (actual behavior), only by holding the CTRL button while selecting a new filter.
fields.summary: Quick filter selection

fields.description:
It would be great to have the link on Agile board that could direct user to issue navigator, which retrieves issues shown on the board. 

For example:
* Link in the backlog mode retrieves all issues shown in the backlog mode
* Link in the active sprint mode retrieves all issues shown in the active sprint mode

The idea is to allow the customer to do a bulk update to the issues, look for the value of certain issue fields of those issues.
fields.summary: Having link on Agile board that direct user to issue navigator

fields.description: At the moment, by default, ISSUE KEY would be shown in the card. It would be great to have the option to choose whether to show ISSUE KEY or ISSUE SUMMARY. This is because some of the users are more familiar with issue summary than issue key.
fields.summary: Having the option to show ISSUE KEY or ISSUE SUMMARY in the card layout

fields.description:
From the "More" menu of an issue fullscreen display, there are options for "Clone" and "Create Sub-Task".

It would be immensely useful to have a "Create Linked Issue" feature.

A poor substitute would be the ability to first select "Link" issue and then be given the option to create one from that dialog.
fields.summary: Need a "Create Linked Issue" feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If I create an epic and set the security level, the issues are not visible, but any issue in this epic still shows it in the description.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic.
# Set the security to "Reporters and Developers"
# Create an Issue (public).
# Set this issue in this epic.

h3. Expected Results
At this point, as a public user, I shouldn't see this epic anywhere.  Which for the most part is correct, it doesn't show up in the agile board.  The epic issue is not visible etc.

h3. Actual Results
The epic issue is invisible expect when viewing the issue details for the issue created in step 3.  This shows a lozenge for the epic issue and has a click through.  The link goes to the epic's issue and the user is prompted for a login.  I would have expected this to not be visible.
fields.summary: Private epics still visible on public issue

fields.description:
Go to Column management in the configuration of project.
Do a drag&drop action on some items from "Unmapped Statuses" to right columns
Please see video for more detail
fields.summary: Status is displaced when moving them in the Column Configuration page

fields.description:
*Steps To Reproduce:*
# Opening the Agile board

*Actual Results:*
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Brace.noConflict is not a function

{code:java}
An error occurredHide...
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.

fields.summary: Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Brace.noConflict is not a function in Agile boards

fields.description:
*Background*
This request would fulfill any query that is running reports against closed sprints. This allows for easy extension of Sprint reporting via dashboards and gadgets on JIRA dashboards as well as Confluence dashboards.

*Use-case*
These types of queries are completely analogous to the specific JQL function {{latestReleasedVersion()}} available against *Fix Version/s*, *Affects Version/s* fields and custom fields extending that type. This obviously would return the most recently completed sprint's issues.

*Example*
I should be able to write a query such as:
{code:SQL}project = ExDevelopment AND Sprint in lastSprint(){code}
fields.summary: In a Filter, I should be able to query for issues closed in the most recently closed sprint

fields.description: We would like the ability to have inline editing on Dashboard Widgets, especially issue filter results e.g: editing priority, issue type, severity etc... which would make it easier to do a quick triage when managing a list of tickets.
fields.summary: Inline Editing on Dashboard Widgets

fields.description:
Hello,  
We used to have the option under MORE drop down to insert picture now it gives the option to attach file.  Is it possible to have the option to insert screenshot.
fields.summary: Insert picture

fields.description:
We constantly run into issues where Team A using sprint name Iteration 1 and Team B uses the same name but on 2 different sprints.  This causes teams to not be able to start/complete sprints since the owners of Team A are not on Team B.  The only way around this we have found is to have team remove the unstarted sprint and recreate it with a new name or have a JIRA Administrator complete/start it for them since we have access to all projects.  We even had an issue today where 1 planned sprint had the same name created as an active sprint on a different board.  When the planned sprint was attempted to be started it could not start.  When they renamed the planned sprint it renamed the active sprint.  They had to delete the planned sprint and start over just to get back this but there was not indication of the issue in the UI.  I was able to see this in the database.  
 
We a way to enforce/correct the use of duplicate sprint names so it does not occur on current/future sprints?
fields.summary: Duplicate Sprint names causes multiple issues with teams

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
This request is originated from the below KB article: [Epic Tag or Label is missing on Sprint board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Epic+Tag+or+Label+is+missing+on+Sprint+board].
Basically, when Epics links created from multiple projects in the Agile board, the Epic tag/label will not appear in the agile board itself unless you add the respective projects in the board filter. This will also have all the epics from the second project displayed in the epics column.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can only those, which are linked with the issues in one particular project.
h3. Workaround 
You can change the board filter to something like the following:
{code}
(project = "PROJECT1" AND status not in (XY) AND (labels != XY OR labels is EMPTY)) OR (project = "PROJECT2" AND issue in linkedIssues(ParentIssue, "LinkType")) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
fields.summary: better filtering for epic link from multiple projects

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a sample kanban board
# Visit the board and click on Release 

*Expected Results:*
Issues should only be released with a resolution set.

*Actual Results:*
No resolution is set by Agile when releasing a version.

*Workaround:*
# Run a search query that will bring all issues released
# Bulk edit them to set a resolution.
OR
# Create a post-function on your workflow on the Close/Done transition to "Update field" to set a proper resolution
# Run a search query that will bring all issues released and bulk transition then through this status again.

*Versions:*
JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02
JIRA Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040
fields.summary: Releasing version through Kanban should ask for issue resolution if none is set.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issues that are still in a progress status and moved back to the backlog when closing a sprint shows the sprint they came from. If the issue then is placed in a new sprint this new sprint is presented along-side the previous. 

h3. Suggested Solution
We feel that there should be a clear distinction in the presentation of the sprints in this case, perhaps a strike-out on the sprint name from which the issue was not completed in, or maybe marked in red color.
fields.summary: previous sprint should have clear distinction

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Most of the times we have some issues that are not completed (resolved or closed) when we close a sprint. These issues gets automatically moved to the backlog but still they are in the same status (In Progress or any other status prior to resolved or closed).

h3. Suggested Solution
We suggest that all issues in the backlog should be evaluated regarding prior and time estimates. It should offer some option to automatically change the status of the issues described earlier to some specific status when we close the sprint.
fields.summary: Changing status on issues when closing sprint

fields.description:
Hello!

Is there a way I can filter the issues that generated a scope change of a certain Sprint besides the Burndown Chart of the Reports on the Board?

Thanks!
fields.summary: How to get Scope Change Issues

fields.description:
As an avid user of Agile Boards, I would like the ability to use color/styling/etc. on the Quick Filter names, so that it is easier to use multiple Quick Filters.

See the attachment for an example of how we use large numbers of filters.

!pic.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support markup/html tags for Quick Filter names

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today is possible to add/remove extra fields in JIRA Agile cards, however is not possible to remove any of the default fields (_Issue Key_ and _Summary_).

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to manage all fields from the Agile Cards, including the default ones, so the administrator can define which information is important to show to the users.
fields.summary: Ability to customize all information from Agile Cards

fields.description:
I'd like to have an easy way to create a report of points completed by epic.  This helps our stakeholders know where our efforts have gone, and how far we have to go.  Ideally one would be able to choose the timeframe for this report (this sprint, in a past sprint, for the past __ sprints, since the beginning of the project, etc.).

Right now I'm creating this in Excel, so it would be wonderful to have something automatic.   Thanks for considering!
fields.summary: Create a report of points completed by epic

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When the user starts a sprint, user can specify *start date* and *end date*. However, JIRA Agile will not count it as 1 working day if it's less than 24 hours. This causes sprint to have less expected working days specified.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create sprint
# Set start date, for example {{17/Aug/15 12:05 AM}}
# Set end date, for example {{17/Aug/15 11:59 PM}}

h4. Expected result
JIRA Agile will count it as 1 working day, as it already passes 8 working hours (normal working hour)

h4. Actual result
JIRA Agile count it as *0 working days*
!start.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional Information
When the customer sets the date from August 17th - August 21st, it will count it as 4 working days, where it actually 5 working days. This will affect the report for the users.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile does not count working day for sprint if it's less than 24 hours

fields.description:
Hi,

is it possible to fix this behavior?
1. Go to the board (Backlog)
2. Select any item (detail view appears on the right)
3. Resize the detail view (see attachment)
4. Problem as described and shown in last screenshot
fields.summary: Jira Alaska Board resize is not working correctly

fields.description:
h4. Description
Velocity chart shows only data for last 7 sprints. This is undesirable if it is needed to see the reports from older sprints.

h4. Suggestion
Allow the chart to include more sprints on report. If possible, make it configurable via user interface.
fields.summary: Allow Velocity Chart report to show more than last 7 past sprints

fields.description:
When adding Liked Issue field on the card layout I'd expect that it would also reflect the status of those linked issues.

E.g.: SSP-14 has SSP-18 linked. SSP-18 is closed and strikethrough but the same does not happen on the card layout.
!Screen Shot 2015-08-18 at 2.20.35 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Link does not reflect the actual status of the issue on Card Layout

fields.description:
All Epics for all issues in the Backlog in a scrum board should be visible by default.

Today only the Epics included in the filter query is visible in the Backlog of a scrum board. This is a problem since we are using filter queries including issues from many projects marked up with a label or a Team. (Different teams are involved in issues from the same projects.)
fields.summary: In the Backlog all Epics linked to visible issues should be visible

fields.description:
Too many clicks for an action makes users angry, disoriented, and resist adoption. That's why this issue is critical. This is primary navigation functionality.

The "Recent Boards" list in the Agile board menu has a more link.
The More link links to the same list full-screen. It then requires clicking on the "All Boards" link on that screen to actually get what was originally reqested...."More".
fields.summary: More link in "Agile" menu should go to All boards

fields.description:
The issues displayed in the backlog view of a project is quietly filtered based on the Board's columns config.
This is a problem because the backlog has no sense of columns yet uses the columns to filter issues. This relationship can only be discovered when issues go missing. 

If a board is configured such that issue status that are not resolved are put into a resolved (green) column, then they are no longer displayed on the backlog. When an issue is in the active sprint, this is not a big deal. However, once the active sprint is closed, there is no way in the Agile system to view this issue.
fields.summary: Issues can get lost because backlog doesn't use sense of "Resolved"

fields.description:
Sometimes, on a Kanban worfklow the team might want to release issues in pre-determined packages, for example: "Customers App - V1.1", "Products App V2.1" ,etc....

Usually these releases are combined with the customer on a periodic basis, so the versions are also pre-determined and the customer will be told something like "your issues 1, 2 and 3 will be released tomorrow, the rest next week". This implies, in this example, two diferent versions.

At this point the Kanban board disregards existing versions when releasing issues from the board. The release action just prompts the user for a version name and overwrites the existing FixVersion field if already set.

I ask for the following behaviour.
* Honor the existing FixVersion on the issues when releasing from the board.
* On the release dialog:
** Ask for the versions to be released (select distinct fix versions of unrelased issues) on a multi select box. Eg. Versions to release [ Customer-App-v1.1; Orders-App-v2.1; ]
** optionally ask for the remaining issues (FixVersion isNull) to be released on an existing version or a new one (similar behaviour to the Tags/Labels textbox that exists in jira where the user can pick an existing item or type a new one)
fields.summary: Kanban Release Action should allow the user to select an existing version

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: JQL function addedAfterSprintStart don't work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issues appear as strikethrough in the Activity Stream when the resolution field is populated. This is a simple indication that the issue has been completed or done or resolved. However, issues don't get strikethrough in Agile reports (for example Burndown Chart) although they have a resolution. Hence, users don't know whether an issue is resolved or not

h3. Suggested Solution
Strikethrough issues that has a resolution field in the Agile reports

h3. Screenshots
!activity-stream-strikethrough.png|thumbnail!
!Burndown-Chart.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show strikethrough for issues that has been resolved in the Reports

fields.description:
h3. Description
As a JIRA Agile user we believe that feature enhancement would be when moving issues from one project to another to prompt the user if there is a current sprint set and if they want to clear that value.
This would avoid confusions when working with multiple sprints across projects.
fields.summary: Add alert when moving stories that already belong to a Sprint to another project
Improvement in documentation

fields.description:
*Summary*
Board that contained multiple projects should not be able to see "All Reports" button

Steps to reproduce
# Create a board that contained 2 different projects in the filter
# Navigate to Agile Report
# Click on *All Reports* button

Current Behaviour:
The user will encounter the page or error message that tells: *This project isn't available. It may have been deleted or your permissions may have changed*

or

*Project should not be null!*

Expected behaviour:
*All Reports* button should not be there once the board contain multiple of projects.
fields.summary: Board that contained multiple projects should not be able to see "All Reports" button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Velocity Report in in Agile currently only deals with built-in fields in JIRA Agile. If a client has created custom fields that they want to estimate velocity on instead, it's not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an ability to use another field for estimate.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to estimate velocity using custom fields

fields.description:
When there is required field and the sprint field is not part of the create issue screen, then the issue created will end up in the backlog instead of the sprint.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Mark a field as mandatory in the create issue screen.
2. Remove the Sprint field from the create issue screen.
3. Go to the Backlog of the rapidboard.
4. Create a sprint.
5. Try to create an issue via the inline issue create of the sprint.
6. The create issue dialog pops-up because of the required field.
7. Enter the data in the required field and create issue.

Expected Result:
The issue is present in the sprint from which it was created.

Actual Result:
The issue ends up in the backlog.
fields.summary: Inline Issue Create loses sprint selection in cases with a required field and Sprint field is not present on screen

fields.description:
Our team chooses names for sprints according to some theme (e.g., dog breeds) and in alphabetical order.  So ... Afghan hound, Beagle, Corgi, etc.  Right now, we are changing the project icon with each sprint.  

It would be nice if we could have an icon for an individual sprint.
fields.summary: be able to add an icon for an individual sprint

fields.description:
This page needs to be updated 
[Generating reports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Generating+Reports]. The image is old and it doesn't show the new Cloud interface and how to access the reports. It is missing to say how to access different reports, by clicking in the name of the chart.
fields.summary: Outdated documentation for JIRA Agile reports

fields.description:
I would like to create a custom field that shows available sprints for the project the issue is created for.
This should work similar to the versions field that can be reused as custom field.
fields.summary: Make Sprints an extended field-type for custom fields

fields.description:
I put together JQL queries to indicate a board card colors such that 

{color:red}Red {color}– over 20 calendar days since this item was moved into this stage (note the issue could bounce around, between stages and this will turn red if the original time going into this stage was over 20 calendar days ago)
{color:#f6c342}Yellow {color}- over 10 calendar days since this item was moved into this stage
{color:#14892c}Green {color}– less than 10 calendar days since this item was moved into this stage

Here is a screen shot that shows my queries:

!color_cards_JIRA.jpg|thumbnail!

Being able to use indicators on our KANBAN board, such as color cards to to visually show items that are starting to become or have been stagnant makes the boards much more usable & informative.  However, this use of color cards makes the page extremely slow to load.  Clicking on any story for a detailed view results in a long pause for the end user as the page loads again.   On my team users do not want to work with this view, despite having it display useful information.  Can an alternative solution be provided or can this solution be made more efficient on the backend?
fields.summary: Long Page Load Time - Color Cards on Board to Indicate Duration In Status

fields.description:
Currently in Plan mode of the Agile board, the estimation is summed for the sprint and specifically show how much estimation in which Status Categories. 

It would be nice to have if the estimation badge, highlighted in red below:

!planestimate.png!

Would not only show the estimate of the issue, but also place it according to the color of the status categories it belongs to.

It ease the overview of the board without having to navigate to the work mode to verify.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have Color Estimation Badge

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Rapid Board throws 500 error for empty board query

h3. Environment
* JIRA Agile version {{1000.163.1}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as an admin
# Go to the issues search and create a new filter with empty criteria.
# Create an agile board with the existing filter 
!13-board-saved-filter.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The empty board should be created

h3. Actual Results
When you hit create you see the 500 error page with the following stacktrace:
https://paste.internal.atlassian.com/view/16932
 
h3. Workaround
Re-indexing seems to resolve the issue.

h3. Notes
This does not happen all the time.
fields.summary: Rapid Board throws 500 error for empty board query

fields.description:
At this moment, in Kanban board, the time spent in status will be shown in the forms of dots. When the user hovers the cursor to the dots, it will show *X days in this column*.
!kanban.png|thumbnail!

It would be great to have the option to automatically show the time in status in the form of digit to ease the users.
fields.summary: Show time in status in digit (Kanban Board)

fields.description:
This is related to GHS-5703. Not everyone uses numbers to indicate successive sprints; some people use letters.

Current behavior:

"Cool Sprint P" -> "Cool Sprint P 2"

Desired behavior:

"Cool Sprint P" -> "Cool Sprint Q"
fields.summary: If Sprint Name Ends with space+letter, increment the letter

fields.description:
Currently we do have epics however labels work just like #tags. Users apply several labels to a single story in order to 
# Remember it
# Differentiating
# Quick Search
# More Readable
fields.summary: As a user, I should be able to change the color of labels for better visibility.

fields.description:
At the moment, the active sprint mode in the board allows groups to be collapsed for easier overview. The setting of which group is collapsed is stored for the user, but not properly restored when the list of groups (typically, parent issues) changes.
For example:
Three parent issues (A, B, C) exist with subtasks
A and C are collapsed
When B is closed and removed from view, because of a 'hide closed' filter *{{status not in (Done)}}*
Then C is shown expanded

!before.png|thumbnail!
!after.png|thumbnail!

It would be great to keep the active sprint mode to be at the same state. Looking at the use case above, then it should be issue A and C will remain collapsed.
fields.summary: Having the ability for the active sprint mode in the board to keep the state (collapsed/expanded)
